decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a variety of powerful creatures that can quickly put pressure on them. By utilizing strong creatures like Questing Beast and Lovestruck Beast, alongside spells like Primal Might and Ram Through, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and secure a quick victory. The inclusion of cards like Gemrazer and Scavenging Ooze can help deal with any threats the opponent may play, while cards like The Great Henge provide additional card draw and ramp. Overall, the deck focuses on a strong aggressive strategy to dominate the battlefield.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on using Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to enable its strategy of controlling the board and generating value through cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Mazemind Tome. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Eliminate and Heartless Act, as well as threats like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Elder Gargaroth. By utilizing a mix of board wipes, counterspells, and card advantage engines, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and control the game until it can establish a dominant position and win through powerful late-game threats.

The main goal of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful removal spells. By quickly establishing a board presence with cards like Rimrock Knight, Lovestruck Beast, and Magda, Brazen Outlaw, the deck aims to deal damage to the opponent early on. Goldspan Dragon and Embercleave provide additional burst damage potential, while cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Shatterskull Smashing help control the board and deal with opposing threats. Overall, this Gruul Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay and efficient removal to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and various disruptive spells. The deck utilizes a combination of sacrifice effects, graveyard interaction, and creature stealing to maintain board control and pressure the opponent. Extus, Oriq Overlord and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger are key threats that can be difficult for opponents to deal with. The deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total while disrupting their game plan, ultimately leading to a swift victory.

The main focus of this Izzet Control deck is utilizing powerful control spells and dragons to maintain dominance over the game. By utilizing cards like Prismari Command, Mystical Dispute, and Saw It Coming to counter opponent's spells and disrupt their game plan, while also using dragons like Goldspan Dragon and Inferno of the Star Mounts to put pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes card draw and life gain through Mazemind Tome to help with card advantage and stall the game until the dragons can take over and secure the win.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature plays, with a mix of combat tricks and card advantage engines to maintain pressure on the opponent. By utilizing powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Elite Spellbinder, along with card draw from Edgewall Innkeeper and Showdown of the Skalds, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds flexibility to the deck's mana base, allowing for more consistent plays and stronger board presence. Overall, the deck aims to establish early dominance and push for a fast victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a wide array of removal spells and counterspells, while also ramping up to play powerful late-game threats. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for extra value by blinking permanents to generate card advantage. The deck also includes Emergent Ultimatum as a game-winning card that can fetch powerful spells to overwhelm the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, generate value, and close out the game with impactful spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on managing the board state and controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and high-impact threats. It aims to outvalue the opponent with card advantage and efficient removal, while also setting up for powerful late-game plays with Emergent Ultimatum. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents for extra card draw and utility. The versatile nature of the Sultai color combination provides answers to various threats and ensures that the deck can adapt to different matchups effectively.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while utilizing mill effects to deplete their library. Thieves' Guild Enforcer, Soaring Thought-Thief, and Ruin Crab are key mill cards, while cards like Into the Story and Agadeem's Awakening provide card advantage. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Heartless Act and Drown in the Loch, countering key spells with Mystical Dispute and Disdainful Stroke. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a powerful companion, providing extra value by allowing cards to be played from the graveyard. The overall goal is to outlast the opponent and win through mill or card advantage.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to utilize mill strategies and graveyard manipulation while maintaining a strong control over the board with removal and counterspells. By playing cards like Ruin Crab and Soaring Thought-Thief, the deck aims to mill the opponent's library while also building up their own graveyard. Cards like Drown in the Loch and Into the Story serve as powerful removal and card advantage, while Lurrus of the Dream-Den can provide additional value by recurring cheap creatures. Overall, the deck seeks to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win through attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent's board and hand through a combination of disruption, mill, and creature removal. By utilizing cards like Thieves' Guild Enforcer, Ruin Crab, and Drown in the Loch, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot while securing card advantage with Into the Story. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion enhances the deck's ability to recur key threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through careful resource management and strategic plays.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on playing efficient and aggressive creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Questing Beast, backed up by powerful combat tricks like Embercleave. The deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent by playing creatures with strong stats for their mana cost and utilizing the synergy between cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Lovestruck Beast. With a mix of powerful threats and removal spells, the deck looks to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize or set up their own game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing counter spells, removal, and card draw to outvalue opponents. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant board presence with powerful creatures like Goldspan Dragon and Iymrith, Desert Doom. By generating card advantage with Mazemind Tome and Expressive Iteration, the deck can consistently hit land drops and find its key threats. With a mix of burn spells like Frost Bite and powerful finishers like Alrund's Epiphany, the deck is able to control the pace of the game and secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and utilizing cards like Claim the Firstborn and The Akroan War to maintain control and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The main goal is to apply constant pressure and take advantage of the synergy between cards like Woe Strider and Village Rites to generate card advantage while dealing damage efficiently. Additionally, the inclusion of Jegantha as a companion provides additional flexibility and consistency to the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on using powerful control spells and removal to control the game while ramping up to cast big threats like Vorinclex and Elder Gargaroth. It also utilizes Emergent Ultimatum to search for game-winning combos or value engines. Yorion, Sky Nomad acts as a companion, providing additional utility and value with its enter-the-battlefield effect. The land base is designed to support the three-color mana requirements of Sultai Control while also maximizing consistency and options for ramping and card draw.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast to apply pressure on the opponent early on. By generating card advantage with cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and using Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out powerful threats like Koma, Cosmos Serpent, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The inclusion of disruption spells like Brazen Borrower and counter spells like Negate allows the deck to protect its board while maintaining aggression. The mana base is built to support the aggressive game plan with a mix of pathways and dual lands.
